Baker earned a solid review for her part in "The Bluest Eye", with "The New York Times" writing:\n', 'BULLET::::- "Wolfblood". Character: Dr. Rebecca Whitewood. Actresses: Effie Woods, Letty Butler\n', 'Blue Bloods is an American police procedural drama series that airs on CBS. Its main characters are members of the fictional Reagan family, an Irish Catholic family in New York City with a history of work in law enforcement. "Blue Bloods" stars Tom Selleck as New York City Police Commissioner Frank Reagan; other main cast members include Bridget Moynahan, Donnie Wahlberg, Will Estes, Len Cariou, and Sami Gayle. The show is filmed on location in New York City with occasional references to nearby suburbs. The series debuted on September 24, 2010, with episodes airing on Fridays following "" before being moved to Wednesdays at 10:00\xa0p.m. Eastern and Pacific time and 9:00\xa0p.m. Central and Mountain time for a four-week tryout. After four weeks, it returned to its original Friday 10:00\xa0p.m. Eastern time slot, where it has remained since. On April 12, 2019, CBS renewed the series for a tenth season; it is scheduled to premiere on September 27, 2019.\n', 'Marjorie Johnson, the "Blue Ribbon Baker", is a popular baker from Robbinsdale, Minnesota. First made famous through her guest appearances on KSTP radio\'s Garage Logic, she has since appeared on numerous talk shows including "The Tonight Show with Jay Leno", "The Rosie O\'Donnell Show", and "The View". Marjorie has won over 2,500 fair ribbons including over 1,000 blue ribbons and numerous sweepstakes ribbons.\n', 'BULLET::::- "Blonde Trouble" (1937) as Edna Baker\n', 'He is portrayed by Ethan Hawke in the 2015 film "Born to Be Blue". Blue Bloods is an American police procedural drama series that airs on CBS. Its main characters are members of the fictional Reagan family, an Irish Catholic family in New York City with a history of work in law enforcement. "Blue Bloods" stars Tom Selleck as New York City Police Commissioner Frank Reagan; other main cast members include Bridget Moynahan, Donnie Wahlberg, Will Estes, Len Cariou, and Sami Gayle. The show is filmed on location in New York City with occasional references to nearby suburbs. The series debuted on September 24, 2010, with episodes airing on Fridays following "" before being moved to Wednesdays at 10:00 p.m. Eastern and Pacific time and 9:00 p.m. Central and Mountain time for a four-week tryout. On April 12, 2019, CBS renewed the series for a tenth season; it is scheduled to premiere on September 27, 2019.
